BitInfo.info: HALLST. Control type for hall start procedure
Hall start procedure using BLDC control
Hall start procedure using only PMSM control
SPDFWD. Speed forward without the speed loop
Disable the speed forward in absence of a speed controller
Enable the speed forward in absence of a speed controller
SOLCTR. Control type for stepper open loop
Position control with automatic external reference analogue
Speed control with automatic external reference analogue
RDAREF. Read analogue external reference for torque mode when “Automatically activated after Power On” is enabled

Freeze control using POSOKLIM and TONPOSOK parameters used also for motion complete inside a settle band. Freeze control and motion complete inside a settle band are mutually exclusive (for backwards compatibility).
Freeze control using POSOKLIM_FC and TONPOSOK_FC parameters. It allows simultaneous activation of both freeze control and motion complete inside a settle band.
AXISEN. Behavior at ENABLE input transitions from low to high
ASTART. Start automatically after power on
STPSC. Stop profile for S-curve motion mode
I2TFRA. I2t Fault Reset Action. Only valid if ASR.1 = 0.
Fault Reset will reset I2t fault immediately and allow motor control with reduced capabilities (current limit set to 90% of nominal current)
Fault Reset will not reset I2t fault until the I2t integral is Motor control is not allowed until I2t integral is 0
SWAD25. Switch AD2 and AD5; this feature allows the usage of the +/-10V circuit either on FDBK or on REF
The CANopen interpolation mode (6060h = 7) works as described in the CiA standard.
NMNT. New treatment for negative transmission
TUM0TSSV. TUM0 Target Speed Starting Value
When TUM0 is selected, at the next UPDate instruction the Target Speed Starting Value is the Actual Speed

When TUM0 is selected, at the next UPDate instruction the Target Speed Starting Value is zero.The UPDate instruction resets the ASR.3 bit when TUM0 is selected. When needed, this bit must be set before the UPDate instruction.
INPOL. Select Sink (PNP) or Source (NPN) inputs
I2TINT. I2T Protection Trigger Software Protections Interrupt
Execute Software Protections Interrupt when I2T protection triggered. By default the drive will enter fault state and motor power will be OFF

Do not execute Software Protection Interrupt when I2T protection triggered. The motion will continue running with 90% of Nominal Current set as the current limit until the I2T integral drops to 0. ASR.1 setting is valid only if the current loop is active. If using SOL voltage mode (with no current loop), ASR.1 will always be considered as 0. (the drive will always enter Fault if an i2t error happens).
Normal operation of IQ current controller
Do not use the IQ current controller
OUTPOL. Select Source (PNP) or Sink (NPN) outputs
SFFAACDEC. Separate feedforward for acceleration and deceleration
Same feedforward for acceleration and deceleration
Separate feedforward for acceleration and deceleration
AICSAR5I. for iPOS2401 - activate an internal circuit that switches the analogue REF AD5 input to be able to read +/-10V instead of 0..5V

DNESAPEHP. for dual loop firmwares: do not execute SAP at end of homing procedure. If using absolute encoders, one might want to position the motor on a home switch without resetting the actual absolute encoder value
execute SAP at end of homing procedure;
do not execute SAP at end of homing procedure.
SOLSLDCU. while using SOL with step loss detection
TPOS or object 6062h will be shown into 6064h;
Object will show the encoder value converted into microsteps/ internal units/ the same units as TPOS/ command position units. The factor group also works.
If DER2.1 =1 do not enter fault, do not send 0x7300 EMCY message
If DER2.1 =1, enter fault + set MER.5=1 + send emergency message (0x7300)
SOLSLDFCE. while using SOL with encoder on motor (step loss detection); depends on bit8=1
At AXISON in TMLCAN or entering CANopen state Switched On, if APOS + STALLLIM > (APOS before AXISOFF) - enter Fault state because of Control Error. - The motor moved too much while in Axisoff
SOLSLDRTP. while using SOL with encoder on motor (step loss detection)
At AXISON or Entering CANopen state Operation Enabled, if APOS + STALLLIM bigger (APOS before AXISOFF was executed), rescale APOS according with TPOS; TPOS does not change

If APOS + STALLLIM bigger (APOS before AXISOFF) was executed rescale TPOS according with APOS. APOS does not change. ; this rescaling happens when: when entering CANopen State Switched On, when entering CANopen state Operation enabled, in TMLCAN, when AXISON is executed after an AXISOFF
AOCOOE. only in F510I and F515F and above
will execute AXISON in CANopen Switched On state
will execute AXISON in CANopen Operation Enabled State
COSTPOS. usable only in CANopen firmwares
When entering Operation Enabled while using CSP (Cyclic Synchronous Position) mode 8 or Interpolated Position mode 7, the TPOS remains unchanged

When entering Operation Enabled while using CSP (Cyclic Synchronous Position) mode or Interpolated Position mode the TPOS will be set with the value of APOS; It has the same function as setting ControlWord.14=1 (the motion will use TUM0). ASR2.6 should be used only as an alternative, when the CANopen master cannot set ControlWord.14 to when it is needed
OUT3 used only as general IO
OUT2 used only as general IO
NPIDPCI. new PID position controller implementation (alternate implementation for the D part) - valid only for F514F and F515F and later
-- the behavior is the same as in the older firmware, the value of 6060 is copied in 6061 when the drive switches the state machine in Operational Enable.
= -- copy the modes of operation value (6060) to modes of operation display (6061) when the drive receives a massage (SDO/PDO).
RFCSP. Reference filtering for CSP mode
SOLPIDEN. Enable SOL+PID mode for Stepper Open loop control with encoder on load * Only available for FA00A and newer
= Legacy behaviour - Stepper Open Loop with PID only
= Stepper Open Loop with pure Open Loop control while moving + switch to PID control when reference is complete
= Load sensor used for position control
= Load sensor used for monitoring only
SYMFBKIN. Symmetric Feedback input * Only available for FA00A and newer
SYMREFIN. Symmetric Reference input * Only available for FA00A and newer
SMOOTHRG. Smooth AxisOff / AxisOn reference generation
= Legacy behaviour for factor group according to CiA-402 DSP v.1.1
= New Factor Group Settings according to CiA-402-2
Add Sine wave/white noise to UQREF
Sine wave/white noise is added to IQREF (either in fast or slow loop)
Sine wave is active (either in fast or slow loop)
Sine wave is active in fast loop
Sine wave is active in slow loop
Enable WhiteNoise generation in slow loop
WhiteNoise is added to IQREF (either in fast or slow loop)
Enable WhiteNoise generation in fast loop
Send actual position to slave axes
Send target position to slave axes
Rectangular control mode when the speed reaches the transition value
No data logging during PMSM motor start
Data logging during PMSM motor start
Use independently saturated commands on d and q axes
Compute saturated commands function of Uq and Ud
Dead-time, Vdc compensation and third harmonic injection
EEDACFSOL. Enables the SOL with corrections mode
Do not use position controller; Enable error detection and correction for Stepper Open Loop with feedback on load
Valid setup table is not required
The length of CAN-bus transmit buffer is 1 messages
The length of CAN-bus transmit buffer is 5 messages
Enable TML time interrupt and quickstop mode when a limit switch is reached
Motion complete set when the position reference arrives at the commanded position
Motion complete set when the position feedback arrives at the commanded position and remains in a settle band for a preset stabilize time interval
One I2T protection common for drive and motor
Two I2T protections, one for drive and the other for the motor
Standard – wait time per phase up to 1s
Extended – wait time per phase up to 635s
Simultaneous read /write of 4 general purpose inputs/outputs
Simultaneous read general-purpose inputs and dedicated inputs: Enable, LSP and LSN. Simultaneous set general-purpose outputs and dedicated outputs: Ready and Error.
STBCRT. Standby current for step motors
Common with position control error protection
Separate control error protection for position and speed
LMTSPDACC. Maximal speed/acceleration in motion modes: external, electronic gearing and electronic camming
Symmetrical, only positive or only negative
Separately programmable upper and lower limits
PTCDIM. Enable/disable interrupt 12 – “Position trigger 1..4 change detected”
Enable. After INT12 is enabled, it will activate each time SRH bits or change.
EVNIM. Enable/disable interrupt 11 – “Event set has occurred”
TPIM. Enable/disable interrupt 10 – “Time period has elapsed”
PCAPIM. Enable/disable interrupt 8 – “Capture input transition detected”
LSWNIM. Enable/disable interrupt 7 – “LSN programmed transition detected”
LSWPIM. Enable/disable interrupt 6 – “LSP programmed transition detected”
DLSBIM. Enable/disable interrupt 0 – “Enable input has changed”
MODECHG. When motion mode is changed
Disable the superposition of the electronic gearing mode with a second motion mode
Enable the superposition of the electronic gearing mode with a second motion mode
REFLOC. Analogue external reference for torque/voltage mode update
I2TDPRS. Status of drive i2t protection
EBWPRS. Status of encoder broken wire protection
UVPRS. Status of under voltage protection
OVPRS. Status of over voltage protection
OT2PRS. Status of drive over temperature protection
OT1PRS. Status of motor over temperature protection
I2TMPRS. Status of motor i2t protection
IMAXP. Status of over current protection
I2TDPRM. Mask for drive I2t protection
EBWPRM. Mask for encoder broken wire protection
UVPRM. Mask for under voltage protection
OVPRM. Mask for over voltage protection
OT2PRM. Mask for drive over temperature protection
OT1PRM. Mask for motor over temperature protection
I2TPRM. Mask for motor I2t protection
IMXPRM. Mask for maximum current protection
The motion axis does not belong to group n
The motion axis belongs to group n
AXISID Axis address; value = Individual identification address for the motion axis
CANBTR1. CAN bus Timing Register 1 (BTR1); xx = CAN controller bus timing register 1

Bit 7-0 CANBTR0. CAN bus Timing Register 0 (BTR0)
xx = CAN controller bus timing register 0
OFRDER. EnDat encoder offset read error
ALRSER. EnDat encoder alarm reset error
ALRDER. EnDat encoder alarm read error
SPITTO. SPI timeout on write operation
Error; Remark: The CER.6 bit is automatically reset if the drive successfully receives a new message over CAN.
Initial Axis ID set by software
Initial Axis ID set by hardware
For CAN drives - Internal memory (OTP) checksum error.For EtherCAT drives - EtherCAT adapter communication error
Tried to activate TML heartbeat protocol while CANopen mode was active.
An error occurred during the selected start mode.
UPDWOMC. UPD received for S-curve profile while not in motion complete
UPD instruction received for S-curve profile while the motion complete condition was not met
S-curve parameters caused an invalid profile. UPD instruction was ignored.
SWLSNST. Negative software limit switch status
Negative software limit switch in not active.
Negative software limit switch is active.
SWLSPST. Positive software limit switch status
Positive software limit switch is not active.
Positive software limit switch is active.
Cancelable call instruction received while another cancelable function was active
UPDAX. UPD received during AXISON execution
UPD instruction received while AXSION was executed. The UPD instruction was ignored and it must be sent again when AXISON is completed.
A call to an inexistent function was received.
A call to an inexistent homing routine was received.
A RET/RETI instruction was executed while no function/ISR was active.
The number of nested function calls exceeded the length of TML stack. Last function call was ignored.
POSWRP. Position wraparound (for F514G and F515G or newer)
PTCDIF. Flag for interrupt 12 – “Position trigger 1..4 change detected”
Triggered, Remark: After INT12 is enabled, it will activate each time SRH bits or change.
EVNIF. Flag for interrupt 11 – “Event set has occurred”
TPIF. Flag for interrupt 10 – “Time period has elapsed”
MOTIF. Flag for interrupt 9 – “Motion is complete”
PCAPIF. Flag for interrupt 8 – “Capture input transition detected”
LSWNIF. Flag for interrupt 7 – “LSN programmed transition detected”
LSWPIF. Flag for interrupt 6 – “LSP programmed transition detected”
DSLBIF. Flag for interrupt 0 – “Enable input has changed”
Command error. The cause of the error is described in DER register.
No drive or motor I2T error
WRPSER. Hall sensor missing /Resolver error /BiSS error /Position wrap around error
SCIER. Communication error. For more details, please check CER (Communication Error Register)
No serial or internal communication error
The drive/motor has a valid setup table
The drive/motor has an invalid setup table
No event set, or programmed event not occurred yet
S-curve update denied (UPD instruction received when motion was not complete)
No event set, or programmed event not occurred yet
No function in execution following a cancelable call
A function in execution following a cancelable call
Warning – a cancelable call is issued while another cancelable function is in execution
INCAM. Reference position in absolute electronic camming mode
INGEAR. Gear ratio in electronic gearing mode
Drive I2T warning limit not reached
Motor I2T warning limit not reached
HIFW. H slave firmware compatibility with motion controller
HISTP. H slave invalid setup table
GIFW. G slave firmware compatibility with motion controller
GISTP. G slave invalid setup table
FIFW. F slave firmware compatibility with motion controller
FISTP. F slave invalid setup table
EIFW. E slave firmware compatibility with motion controller
EISTP. E slave invalid setup table
DIFW. D slave firmware compatibility with motion controller
DISTP. D slave invalid setup table
CIFW. C slave firmware compatibility with motion controller
CISTP. C slave invalid setup table
BIFW. B slave firmware compatibility with motion controller
BISTP. B slave invalid setup table
AIFW. A slave firmware compatibility with motion controller
AISTP. A slave invalid setup table
1 Reference position in absolute electronic camming mode reached
1 Gear ratio in electronic gearing mode reached
1 Drive I2t protection warning level reached
1 Motor I2t protection warning level reached
1 Limit switch negative event / interrupt triggered
1 Limit switch positive event / interrupt triggered
Axis off. Power stage is disabled. Motor control is not performed
Axis on. Power stage is enabled. Motor control is performed
No event set or the programmed event has not occurred yet
Operation Mode Specific. The meaning of these bits is detailed further in this manual for each operation mode
Internal Limit Active – see Remark 1 below
Remote – drive is in local mode and will not execute the command message.
Remote – drive parameters may be modified via CAN and the drive will execute the command message.
No TML function or homing is executed. The execution of the last called TML function or homing is completed.
A TML function or homing is executed. Until the function or homing execution ends or is aborted, no other TML function / homing may be called
Warning. A TML function / homing was called, while another TML function / homing is still in execution. The last call is ignored.
Quick Stop. When this bit is zero, the drive is performing a quick stop
Motor supply voltage is absent See Remark 2 below
Fault. If set, a fault condition is or was present in the drive.
Drive disabled due to enable or STO input. Set when enable or STO input is on disable state. Reset when enable or STO input is on enable state
Command error. This bit is set in several situations. They can be distinguished either by the associated emergency code, or in conjunction with other bits from the DER (2002h) register.
Under-voltage. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command
Over-voltage. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command
Over temperature drive. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command.
Over temperature motor. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command. This protection may be activated if the motor has a PTC or NTC temperature contact.
I 2T protection. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command
Over current. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command
Negative limit switch active. Set when LSN input is in active state. Reset when LSN input is inactive state
Positive limit switch active. Set when LSP input is in active state. Reset when LSP input is inactive state

For F514G and newer: Feedback error. Details found in DER2 (2009h) bits. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command. For F508x/509x; F523x/524x, it represents either digital Hall sensor missing or position wraparound.
Communication error. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command
Control error (position/speed error too big). Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command
nvalid setup data. Set when the EEPROM stored setup data is not valid or not present.
Short-circuit. Set when protection is triggered. Reset by a Reset Fault command
CAN error. Set when CAN controller is in error mode. Reset by a Reset Fault command
EEPROM Locked; an attempt to write in the EEPROM will be ignored.
STO or Enable circuit hardware error
Self-check error; Internal memory (OTP) checksum error
Start mode failed; Motionless start or pole lock minimum movement failed
Encoder broken wire; On a brushless motor, either the digital halls or the incremental encoder signal was interrupted
S-curve parameters caused an invalid profile. UPD instruction was ignored.
Negative software limit switch is active.
Positive software limit switch is active.
Cancelable call instruction received while another cancelable function was active.
UPD instruction received while AXISON was executed. The UPD instruction was ignored and it must be sent again when AXISON is completed.
A call to an inexistent function was received.
A call to an inexistent homing routine was received.
A RET/RETI instruction was executed while no function/ISR was active.
The number of nested function calls exceeded the length of TML stack. Last function call
CAN bus off error. It is automatically reset if the drive successfully receives a new message over CAN.
Output frequency. The imposed speed exceeds the DUAL USE European regulation limit.
Hall sensor missing; can be either Digital or Linear analogue hall error.
Absolute Encoder Interface (AEI) interface error; applies only to iPOS80x0 drives.
BiSS sensor missing; No BiSS sensor communication detected.
BiSS data error bit is set.
BiSS data warning bit is set.
When an update is performed, keep unchanged the demand values for speed and position (TML command TUM1;)
When an update is performed, update the demand values for speed and position with the actual values of speed and position (TML command TUM0;)
When it is set, it cancels the execution of the TML function called through object 2006h. The bit is automatically reset by the drive when the command is executed.
If bit 14 = 1 – Force position demand value to 0. If bit 14 = 0 – Force position actual value to 0. This bit is valid regardless of the status of the drive or other bits in Controlword
Manufacturer Specific - Operation Mode Specific. The meaning of this bit is detailed further in this manual for each operation mode
Reserved. Writes have no effect. Read as 0
Halt command – the motor will slow down on slow down ramp
Reset Fault. The faults are reset on 0 to 1 transition of this bit. After a Reset Fault command, the master has to reset this bit.
Operation Mode Specific. The meaning of these bits is detailed further in this manual for each operation mode
When an update is performed, keep unchanged the demand values for speed and position (TML command TUM1;)
When an update is performed, update the demand values for speed and position with the actual values of speed and position (TML command TUM0;)
When it is set, it cancels the execution of the TML function called through object 2006h. The bit is automatically reset by the drive when the command is executed.
If bit 14 = 1 – Force position demand value to 0. If bit 14 = 0 – Force position actual value to 0. This bit is valid regardless of the status of the drive or other bits in Controlword
Trapezoidal profile - In case the movement is relative, do not add the new target position to the old demand position S-curve profile – Stop the motion with S-curve profile (jerk limited ramp)

Trapezoidal profile - In case the movement is relative, add the new target position to the old demand position to obtain the new target position S-curve profile – Stop the motion with trapezoidal profile (linear ramp)
Reserved. Writes have no effect. Read as 0
Halt command – Stop drive with profile acceleration
Reset Fault. The faults are reset on 0 to 1 transition of this bit. After a Reset Fault command, the master has to reset this bit.
Target position is an absolute value
Target position is a relative value
Finish the actual positioning and then start the next positioning
Interrupt the actual positioning and start the next positioning. Valid only for linear ramp profile
New set-point. Only a 0 to 1 transition will start a new motion - UPD
When an update is performed, keep unchanged the demand values for speed and position (TML command TUM1;)
When an update is performed, update the demand values for speed and position with the actual values of speed and position (TML command TUM0;)
When it is set, it cancels the execution of the TML function called through object 2006h. The bit is automatically reset by the drive when the command is executed.
If bit 14 = 1 – Force position demand value to 0. If bit 14 = 0 – Force position actual value to 0 This bit is valid regardless of the status of the drive or other bits in Controlword
Stop Option: On transition to inactive mode, stop drive immediately using profile acceleration
On transition to inactive mode, stop drive after finishing the current segment.
Reserved. Writes have no effect. Read as 0
Reset Fault. The faults are reset on 0 to 1 transition of this bit. After a Reset Fault command, the master has to reset this bit.
Set position is an absolute value
Set position is a relative value (similar to Cyclic Synchronous Velocity)

Register.Title: Controlword in Cyclic Synchronous Position Mode (CSP)

BitInfo.info: When an update is performed, keep unchanged the demand values for speed and position (TML command TUM1;)
When an update is performed, update the demand values for speed and position with the actual values of speed and position (TML command TUM0;)
When it is set, it cancels the execution of the TML function called through object 2006h. The bit is automatically reset by the drive when the command is executed.
If bit 14 = 1 – Force position demand value to 0. If bit 14 = 0 – Force position actual value to 0 This bit is valid regardless of the status of the drive or other bits in Controlword
Stop Option: On transition to inactive mode, stop drive immediately using profile acceleration
On transition to inactive mode, stop drive after finishing the current segment.
Reserved. Writes have no effect. Read as 0
Reset Fault. The faults are reset on 0 to 1 transition of this bit. After a Reset Fault command, the master has to reset this bit.

Register.Title: ControlWord Manufacturer specific – External Reference Speed Mode

BitInfo.info: When an update is performed, keep unchanged the demand values for speed and position (TML command TUM1;)
When an update is performed, update the demand values for speed and position with the actual values of speed and position (TML command TUM0;)
When it is set, it cancels the execution of the TML function called through object 2006h. The bit is automatically reset by the drive when the command is executed.
If bit 14 = 1 – Force position demand value to 0. If bit 14 = 0 – Force position actual value to 0. This bit is valid regardless of the status of the drive or other bits in Controlword
Stop Option: On transition to inactive mode, stop drive immediately using profile acceleration
On transition to inactive mode, stop drive after finishing the current segment.
Reserved. Writes have no effect. Read as 0
Reset Fault. The faults are reset on 0 to 1 transition of this bit. After a Reset Fault command, the master has to reset this bit.
Do not limit acceleration on the inactive to active mode transition
Limit acceleration when enabling the External Speed mode with the value defined in object 6083h

Register.Title: ControlWord Manufacturer specific – Electronic Camming Position Mode

BitInfo.info: When an update is performed, keep unchanged the demand values for speed and position (TML command TUM1;)
When an update is performed, update the demand values for speed and position with the actual values of speed and position (TML command TUM0;)
When it is set, it cancels the execution of the TML function called through object 2006h. The bit is automatically reset by the drive when the command is executed.
If bit 14 = 1 – Force position demand value to 0. If bit 14 = 0 – Force position actual value to 0.This bit is valid regardless of the status of the drive or other bits in Controlword
Stop Option: On transition to inactive mode, stop drive immediately using profile acceleration
On transition to inactive mode, stop drive after finishing the current segment.
Reserved. Writes have no effect. Read as 0
Reset Fault. The faults are reset on 0 to 1 transition of this bit. After a Reset Fault command, the master has to reset this bit.
Perform relative camming mode – when entering the camming mode, the slave will compute the cam table relative to the starting moment.
Perform absolute camming mode – when entering the camming mode, the slave will go to the absolute position on the cam table
Do not limit speed when entering absolute electronic camming mode
Limit speed when entering absolute electronic camming mode at the value set in profile velocity (ONLY for absolute mode)
0 -> 1 Start electronic camming procedure;1 -> 0 Does nothing (does not stop current procedure)

Register.Title: ControlWord Manufacturer specific – Electronic Gearing Position Mode

BitInfo.info: When an update is performed, keep unchanged the demand values for speed and position (TML command TUM1;)
When an update is performed, update the demand values for speed and position with the actual values of speed and position (TML command TUM0;)
When it is set, it cancels the execution of the TML function called through object 2006h. The bit is automatically reset by the drive when the command is executed.
If bit 14 = 1 – Force position demand value to 0. If bit 14 = 0 – Force position actual value to 0. This bit is valid regardless of the status of the drive or other bits in Controlword
Stop Option: On transition to inactive mode, stop drive immediately using profile acceleration
On transition to inactive mode, stop drive after finishing the current segment.
Reserved. Writes have no effect. Read as 0
Reset Fault. The faults are reset on 0 to 1 transition of this bit. After a Reset Fault command, the master has to reset this bit.
Do not limit acceleration when entering electronic gear mode
Limit acceleration when entering electronic gear mode to the value set in profile acceleration (object 6083h)
0 -> 1 Start electronic gearing procedure;1 -> 0 Does nothing (does not stop current procedure)

Axis on. Power stage is enabled. Motor control is performed

A TML function or homing is executed. Until the function or homing execution ends or is aborted, no other TML function / homing may be called
Warning. A TML function / homing was called, while another TML function / homing is still in execution. The last call is ignored.
Quick Stop. When this bit is zero, the drive is performing a quick stop
Motor supply voltage is absent See Remark 2 below
Fault. If set, a fault condition is or was present in the drive.
Axis off. Power stage is disabled. Motor control is not performed
Axis on. Power stage is enabled. Motor control is performed
No event set or the programmed event has not occurred yet
Halt = 0: Target velocity not (yet) reached Halt = 1: Drive decelerates
Halt = 0: Target velocity reached Halt = 1: Velocity of drive is 0
Remote – drive is in local mode and will not execute the command message.
Remote – drive parameters may be modified via CAN and the drive will execute the command message.
No TML function or homing is executed. The execution of the last called TML function or homing is completed.
A TML function or homing is executed. Until the function or homing execution ends or is aborted, no other TML function / homing may be called
Warning. A TML function / homing was called, while another TML function / homing is still in execution. The last call is ignored.
Quick Stop. When this bit is zero, the drive is performing a quick stop
Motor supply voltage is absent See Remark 2 below
Fault. If set, a fault condition is or was present in the drive.

Axis on. Power stage is enabled. Motor control is performed
No event set or the programmed event has not occurred yet
Halt = 0: Always 0; Halt = 1: Velocity of drive is 0
Remote – drive is in local mode and will not execute the command message.
Remote – drive parameters may be modified via CAN and the drive will execute the command message.

Quick Stop. When this bit is zero, the drive is performing a quick stop

BitInfo.info: Axis off. Power stage is disabled. Motor control is not performed
Axis on. Power stage is enabled. Motor control is performed
No event set or the programmed event has not occurred yet
Halt = 0: Always 0; Halt = 1: Velocity of drive is 0
Remote – drive is in local mode and will not execute the command message.
Remote – drive parameters may be modified via CAN and the drive will execute the command message.
No TML function or homing is executed. The execution of the last called TML function or homing is completed.
A TML function or homing is executed. Until the function or homing execution ends or is aborted, no other TML function / homing may be called
Warning. A TML function / homing was called, while another TML function / homing is still in execution. The last call is ignored.
Quick Stop. When this bit is zero, the drive is performing a quick stop
Motor supply voltage is absent See Remark 2 below
Fault. If set, a fault condition is or was present in the drive.
Interlock (Drive enable/ STO input) activated; drive may apply power to motor
Interlock (Drive enable/ STO input) deactivated; drive may not apply power to motor. Enter Switch on disabled state.
Home switch input status is low
Home switch input status is high
Interlock (Drive enable/ STO input) activated; drive may apply power to motor
Interlock (Drive enable/ STO input) deactivated; drive may not apply power to motor. Enter Switch on disabled state.
Home switch input status is low
Home switch input status is high
OUT5 = 1 when Position trigger 4 = 0 || OUT5 = 0 when Position trigger 4 = 1
OUT5 = 0 when Position trigger 4 = 0 || OUT5 = 1 when Position trigger 4 = 1
OUT1 = 1 when Position trigger 2 = 0 || OUT1 = 0 when Position trigger 2 = 1
OUT1 = 0 when Position trigger 2 = 0 || OUT1 = 1 when Position trigger 2 = 1
OUT0 = 1 when Position trigger 1 = 0 || OUT0 = 0 when Position trigger 1 = 1
OUT0 = 0 when Position trigger 1 = 0 || OUT0 = 1 when Position trigger 1 = 1
Disable position trigger 4 control of OUT5
Enable position trigger 4 control of OUT5
Disable position trigger 2 control of OUT1
Enable position trigger 2 control of OUT1
Disable position trigger 1 control of OUT0
Enable position trigger 1 control of OUT0
Set interpolation mode compatible with PT and PVT (legacy)
Set interpolation mode (when 6060=7) as described in the CiA402 standard
When 6040 bit 14 = 1, at the next update, the Target Speed Starting Value is the Actual Speed
When 6040 bit 14 = 1, at the next update, the Target Speed Starting Value is zero
Set actual position to the value of the homing offset 607Ch at the end of the homing procedure
After finishing a homing procedure, do not reset the actual position. Homing ends keeping position on home switch.
Position polarity: Multiply by 1 the values of objects 607Ah, 6062h and 6064h
Multiply by -1 the values of objects 607Ah, 6062h and 6064h
Velocity polarity: Multiply by 1 the values of objects 60FFh, 606Bh and 606Ch
Multiply by -1 the values of objects 60FFh, 606Bh and 606Ch
Buffer is empty – there is no point in the buffer.
Buffer is low – the number of points from the buffer is equal or less than the low limit set using object 2074h.
Buffer is full – the number of points in the buffer is equal with the buffer dimension.
Integrity counter error. If integrity counter error checking is enabled and the integrity counter sent by the master does not match the integrity counter of the drive.
Valid only for PVT (cubic interpolation): Drive has maintained interpolated position mode after a buffer empty condition (the velocity of the last point was 0).
Valid only for PVT (cubic interpolation): Drive has performed a quick stop after a buffer empty condition because the velocity of the last point was different from 0
Clear buffer and reinitialize buffer internal variables
Enable the integrity counter error checking
Disable the integrity counter error checking
No change in the integral integrity counter
Change internal integrity counter with the value specified in bits 0 to 6
If absolute positioning is set (bit 6 of Controlword is 0), the initial position is read from object 2079h. It is used to compute the distance to move up to the first PVT point.
If absolute positioning is set (bit 6 of Controlword is 0), the initial position is the current position demand value. It is used to compute the distance to move up to the first PVT point.
New parameter for buffer low signaling. When the number of entries in the buffer is equal or less than buffer low value, bit 14 of object 2072h will set.
No change in the buffer low parameter
Change the buffer low parameter with the value specified in bits 8 to 11
Master is not active – the master drive does not send any position values
Master is active – the master drive starts sending its position to the slave axis
The master sends its feedback (the position actual value)
The master sends the demand position
x Address of the slave drive(s)
Switch off sampling at negative edge of touch probe 2
Enable sampling at negative edge of touch probe 2*
Switch off sampling at positive edge of touch probe 2
Enable sampling at positive edge of touch probe 2*
00b: Trigger with touch probe 2 input (LSN input)|| 01b" Trigger with zero impulse signal || 10b: Reserved || 11b: Reserved
Enable limit switch functionality. The motor will stop, using quickstop deceleration, when a limit switch is active.
Disable limit switch functionality. The motor will not stop when a limit switch is active.
Switch off sampling at negative edge of touch probe
1 Enable sampling at negative edge of touch probe 1*
Switch off sampling at positive edge of touch probe
1 Enable sampling at positive edge of touch probe 1*
00b: Trigger with touch probe 1 input (LSP input) || 01b: Trigger with zero impulse signal || 10b: Reserved || 11b: Reserved
Touch probe 2 no negative edge value stored
Touch probe 2 negative edge position stored in object 60BDh
Touch probe 2 no positive edge value stored
Touch probe 2 positive edge position stored in object 60BCh

Touch probe 1 no positive edge value stored
Touch probe 1 positive edge position stored in object 60BAh

Enable sampling at negative edge of touch probe
Switch off sampling at positive edge of touch probe
Enable sampling at positive edge of touch probe

Auxiliary feedback touch probe negative edge position stored in object 2107h
Auxiliary feedback touch probe no positive edge value stored

Auxiliary feedback touch probe is enabled
16-bit memory address for the next read/write operation
Auto-increment the address after the read/write operation
Do not auto-increment the address after the read/write operation
00 Memory type is program memory || 01 Memory type is data memory || 10 Memory type is EEPROM memory || 11 Reserved
Next read/write operation is with a 16-bit data
Next read/write operation is with a 32-bit data

BitInfo.info: Reserved if bit 0 of object 2064h is 0 (operation on 16 bit variables)
16-bit MSB of data if bit 0 of object 2064h is 1 (operation on 32 bit variables)
16 bit data value to be written
16 bit start address of the checksum
